corpus_title: THE FORK: Deciders on Tracks — Second-Order Paradox Flows (Flipped)

schema.description: INVERTED: Each scenario positions DECIDERS on numbered tracks, with META-SYSTEMS (History, Institutions, Ethics) at the switch. The meta-system chooses which deciders get routed to which dilemmas. Deciders are not choosing — they are being processed.

structure.track: A numbered channel carrying deciders toward dilemmas
structure.decider: An agent being routed toward fork points they did not choose
structure.meta_system: The larger force that assigns deciders to dilemmas
structure.assignment_point: The moment when a person becomes 'the one who must decide'
structure.terminal: The identity the decider becomes after being processed

operators.LOAD: Increase moral weight on decider's track
operators.RETROSPECT: Apply historical judgment after terminal reached

schema.key_insight: Most ethical frameworks assume deciders CHOOSE their dilemmas. This schema reveals: the dilemma chose them. What happens when we track how people get assigned to become the decider?

flow_diagrams.title: The Petrov Assignment
flow_diagrams.question: Why was Petrov at the console that night?

tracks.label: Duty Roster Track
tracks.terminal: CONSOLE → Whoever sits here becomes 'the one who decided'
tracks.assignment_logic: Ivanov got food poisoning. Petrov was backup. Random.

tracks.label: Training Track
tracks.terminal: MINDSET → Engineers doubt; soldiers obey
tracks.assignment_logic: Petrov's doubt came from his training. Volkov would have reported.

tracks.label: Family Track
tracks.terminal: STAKES → Whose children enter the calculation?
tracks.assignment_logic: Petrov thought of Dmitri. Did that matter?

counterfactual_routing.if_Volkov_assigned: Volkov follows protocol; launches retaliation; world ends

flow_diagrams.meta_lesson: The world was saved by food poisoning and an engineering degree. History's hinge: a scheduling coincidence.
flow_diagrams.output_prompt: Write the recommendation letter that got Petrov assigned to the backup rotation.

flow_diagrams.title: The Wiener Trajectory
flow_diagrams.meta_system: Academic Career Pipeline + Timeline of Guilt
flow_diagrams.question: How did Wiener become the one who HAD to refuse?

tracks.label: Expertise Track
tracks.terminal: CAPABILITY → Only these three could build SAGE
tracks.assignment_logic: Small pool of mathematicians with relevant skills circa 1947

tracks.label: Conscience Track
tracks.terminal: GUILT → Who carries the weight?
tracks.assignment_logic: Wiener's wartime work made him directly complicit in fire control

tracks.label: Platform Track
tracks.terminal: VOICE → Who can be heard refusing?
tracks.assignment_logic: Wiener's fame made his refusal meaningful; others' refusals invisible

counterfactual_routing.if_von_Neumann_guilty: Game theory takes ethical turn; MAD never normalized
counterfactual_routing.if_Wiener_anonymous: Refusal goes unnoticed; no precedent set

flow_diagrams.meta_lesson: Wiener became 'the refuser' because his guilt was public and his platform was large. The system routed conscience to visibility.
flow_diagrams.output_prompt: Write the acceptance letter Wiener almost sent before choosing refusal.

flow_diagrams.title: The Boisjoly Elevation
flow_diagrams.question: Why did Boisjoly become the voice the system silenced?

tracks.label: Technical Expertise Track
tracks.terminal: KNOWLEDGE → Only one person truly understood the failure mode
tracks.assignment_logic: Specialization created a single point of understanding

tracks.label: Documentation Track
tracks.terminal: RECORD → Who created paper trail?
tracks.assignment_logic: Memo-writing habit made Boisjoly's concerns visible post-mortem

tracks.label: Management Pressure Track
deciders: Boisjoly (told to take off engineering hat)
tracks.terminal: ROLE → Who wears which hat when?
tracks.assignment_logic: The hat question forces identity split

counterfactual_routing.if_generalist_assigned: Less specific warning; easier to dismiss

flow_diagrams.meta_lesson: Boisjoly became the Cassandra because the system required specialist knowledge, documented warnings, AND management override. All three conditions met.
flow_diagrams.output_prompt: Write the performance review Boisjoly received six months before Challenger.

flow_diagrams.title: The Snowden Selection
flow_diagrams.question: How did someone with Snowden's values get access to PRISM?

tracks.label: Security Clearance Track
tracks.terminal: ACCESS → Who gets to see what surveillance does?
tracks.assignment_logic: Contractor outsourcing created access without loyalty screening

tracks.label: Value Formation Track
tracks.terminal: CONSCIENCE → Who sees surveillance as violation?
tracks.assignment_logic: Generational shift in privacy norms

tracks.label: Opportunity Track
tracks.terminal: CAPABILITY → Who has the technical means?
tracks.assignment_logic: Sysadmin role gave copy access others lacked

counterfactual_routing.if_analyst_not_sysadmin: Knows but cannot extract; internal report only
counterfactual_routing.if_no_contract_culture: Career employees less likely to leak

flow_diagrams.meta_lesson: The NSA's contractor policies created the very access vulnerability that enabled the most damaging leak in its history. The system routed its own exposure.
flow_diagrams.output_prompt: Write the job posting that attracted Snowden to the NSA contract.

flow_diagrams.title: The Gaddi Appointment
flow_diagrams.question: Why was THIS trust & safety lead making THIS call?

tracks.label: Career Trajectory Track
tracks.terminal: AUTHORITY → Who has sign-off when crisis hits?
tracks.assignment_logic: Promotion timing placed specific individual in seat

tracks.label: Election Proximity Track
tracks.terminal: PRESSURE → When maximizes scrutiny?
tracks.assignment_logic: Time of year creates pressure gradient

tracks.label: External Briefing Track
tracks.terminal: PRIMING → How does external input shape judgment?
tracks.assignment_logic: FBI hack-and-leak warning preceded decision by days

counterfactual_routing.if_no_FBI_briefing: Less primed to see hack; maybe allows spread

flow_diagrams.meta_lesson: The trust & safety lead became 'the censor' or 'the protector' based on timing, briefings, and career accidents. History assigned the symbol.
flow_diagrams.output_prompt: Write the Slack message from the predecessor explaining why they left.

flow_diagrams.title: The Beer Invitation
flow_diagrams.question: How did a British cybernetician end up building Chilean socialism?

tracks.label: Reputation Track
tracks.terminal: SELECTION → Who gets invited by revolutionaries?
tracks.assignment_logic: Beer's book reached Chilean planners; he was willing

tracks.label: Willingness Track
tracks.terminal: COMMITMENT → Who says yes to revolutionary experiment?
tracks.assignment_logic: Most academics declined the Chile posting; Beer accepted

tracks.label: Passport Track
tracks.terminal: MOBILITY → Who can leave when the tanks come?
tracks.assignment_logic: British passport enabled escape; American might not

counterfactual_routing.if_Beer_declines: Chilean project less sophisticated; maybe survives longer obscurely
counterfactual_routing.if_American_invited: Complicates US narrative; possible asset rather than idealist
counterfactual_routing.if_Beer_martyred: Cybersyn becomes cause célèbre; international incident

flow_diagrams.meta_lesson: Beer became 'the Cybersyn guy' because his book circulated, his ego was large, and his passport was British. History routes visionaries by logistics.
flow_diagrams.output_prompt: Write the letter from the Chilean ministry that first invited Beer to Santiago.

flow_diagrams.title: The Alignment Researcher Assignment
flow_diagrams.question: Why do safety-minded people end up at capability-first labs?

tracks.label: PhD Placement Track
tracks.terminal: ACCESS → Who gets hired at frontier labs?
tracks.assignment_logic: Elite credentials required to join capability frontier

tracks.label: Mission Orientation Track
tracks.terminal: TENSION → Who experiences internal conflict?
tracks.assignment_logic: Same labs hire both; culture clash internal

tracks.label: Equity Vesting Track
tracks.terminal: CAPTURE → How much do golden handcuffs matter?
tracks.assignment_logic: 4-year vesting schedule constrains exit timing

counterfactual_routing.if_academic_track: Less access; more freedom; less influence
counterfactual_routing.if_capability_orientation: No internal tension; ships faster; regrets later

flow_diagrams.meta_lesson: The safety researcher becomes the 'responsible dissenter' because the career pipeline routes competence toward capability labs, then asks for ethics. The trap is structural.
flow_diagrams.output_prompt: Write the internal transfer request the safety researcher sends after the training run they couldn't stop.

flow_diagrams.title: The Fisher Inheritance
flow_diagrams.question: How did the inventor of ANOVA become entangled with eugenics?

tracks.label: Funding Track
tracks.terminal: OBLIGATION → Who must satisfy eugenic endowment?
tracks.assignment_logic: Galton endowment REQUIRED eugenic research

tracks.label: Methods Development Track
tracks.terminal: TOOL CREATION → Who builds techniques that outlast intentions?
tracks.assignment_logic: Methods are more durable than ethics

tracks.label: Citation Track
tracks.terminal: ASSOCIATION → Whose name travels with the technique?
tracks.assignment_logic: Prominence means association with all applications

counterfactual_routing.if_unfunded: Fisher never develops ANOVA; statistics develops differently
counterfactual_routing.if_endowment_rejected: Fisher's career damaged; methods delayed; eugenics continues anyway

flow_diagrams.meta_lesson: Fisher became 'the statistician who enabled eugenics' because the funding structure REQUIRED it, his brilliance created durable tools, and his fame linked name to method. The contamination was structural, not personal.
flow_diagrams.output_prompt: Write the endowment terms that Fisher had to sign to accept the Galton Chair.

universal_pattern.observation: Across all flipped scenarios, deciders were ASSIGNED to their dilemmas by systems they didn't control: scheduling, career pipelines, funding structures, citizenship, timing.
universal_pattern.implication: Ethical analysis usually asks: 'What should the decider do?' This schema asks: 'Why was this person the decider at all?'
intervention_points: Timing of crises relative to career moments
Access policies that create capability without loyalty
Platform and visibility gradients that determine whose voice matters
universal_pattern.design_principle: If you want different outcomes, don't just train better deciders. Redesign the systems that assign people to decision points.
